entry.title: Last Call for Registration: SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3-2025 üì¢
entry.content:
The third cycle of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative for 2025 is still live, featuring 47 new projects offering early insights into SAP's product developments. This is your final chance to register for these projects to work with SAP teams and shape the future of SAP solutions.

üïõTime is Running Out: Registration Closes November 14, 2025

In the dynamic business landscape, early involvement can make a significant impact. Engage directly with SAP product managers and developers, share your feedback, and influence product development from the start.

Explore the available projects from our detailed list here, or follow the links below to discover exciting opportunities:

SAP Ariba

  • Asset Administration Shell (AAS) with SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration

SAP Business Technology Platform

  • Adoption of the SAP Job Scheduling service and it's new capabilities
  • AI-assisted message monitoring agent for SAP Integration Suite

  • Improving the Admin's and Solution Architect's Experience on SAP BTP

  • Shape the future of job orchestration capabilities in SAP Build Process Automation
  • The impact of AI on SAP BTP users

SAP Concur

  • Concur Travel Allowance: Share Your Experiences
  • Discovery for App Center Enhancement

Customer Experience

  • Agentic Innovation in SAP Sales Cloud
  • CX Intelligent Application

Data & Analytics

  • AI- Assisted Summaries in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories
  • Personalized KPI Monitoring Workflow
  • SAP HANA Database Migration to SAP HANA Cloud (XSC,XSA,CAP)

SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Finance & Risk

  • Risk Management Lifecycle for SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Digital Supply Chain Cloud

  • Identify un-assessed assets and auto propose draft risk assessments using AI Agent
  • SAP Digital Battery Passport
  • SAP Field Service Management - Improvements for Maintenance Planning

Private Cloud

  • Compatible Unit Transformation: Modernizing Compatible Unit Management
  • SAP Responsibility Management in ERP Private Cloud and On-Premise
  • Supply and Demand Segmentation: improvements of functionality and integration

Public Cloud

  • A Modern Treasury Experience: New Fiori App for Interest Rate Instrument
  • AI Agent for Accrual Postings SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • AI Agent for Debt Collection
  • AI Assistant for Manual Postings in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Business AI for Product Cost Controlling
  • Joule as Project Assistant: Optimizing Project Execution and Reducing Manual Processes
  • Let‚Äôs Create the Future of US Sales and Use Tax with AI
  • Line Item Settlement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Manage Statistical Key Figure Values: Potential Enhancements
  • Modernizing Inventory valuation - Lower of Cost or Net Realizable Value
  • Parallel Unit of Measure
  • Review Booklets and MDA: the next level of SAP S/4HANA Reporting and Analytics
  • SAP Responsibility Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Enhance the Task Management user experience

Other

Let‚Äôs shape the future together!

Innovation happens through collaboration. By participating in the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you help SAP create better, more relevant solutions for businesses like yours. This is your chance to influence what comes next.

Don‚Äôt miss out - sign up today at influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3 in 2025!

Warm regards, 
Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team 

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. Participation beyond this point is optional and typically governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: SAP Central Finance in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2
entry.content:
SAP Central Finance in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2

We are excited to announce that SAP Central Finance, Private Edition is now generally available in SAP Sovereign Cloud and in SAP National Security Services (NS2).

This new deployment option unlocks the capabilities and benefits of SAP Central Finance for customers with highest security and compliance requirements who cannot use the standard private cloud environment. This is important in particular for customers operating in specific industries, like defense & security, public sector or regulated industries.

 

What is SAP Sovereign Cloud in a nutshell?

SAP Sovereign Cloud

  • is designed to help organizations adopt cloud technologies while maintaining full control over their data, infrastructure, and compliance
  • goes beyond basic digital sovereignty to meet advanced compliance requirements across four key dimensions: data, operational, technical and legal sovereignty
  • is available in selected countries and offers tailored solutions aligned with local regulatory standards

For more information, please have a look into SAP Sovereign Cloud on sap.com.

 

What is Central Finance in a nutshell?

Central Finance is a solution which builds bridges between systems and helps companies in their business transformation. With Central Finance you can connect SAP and Non-SAP systems to an SAP S/4HANA Central Finance system and leverage a harmonized financial reporting across legal entities or enable a centralized financial processing (e.g. shared services for Finance). Central Finance helps companies to move into the cloud, to adopt latest innovation of S/4HANA Cloud including Business AI for Finance, and to transform step by step to an agile company with self-defined pace.

For more information on Central Finance, please explore SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Central Finance.

 

What is the release status and scope of Central Finance in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2?

SAP Central Finance is successfully validated and certified on SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2. This validation includes full technical and security validation. First customers are already live with Central Finance in the NS2 environment.

The Sovereign Cloud release of SAP Central Finance, Private Edition is currently available in following countries:

  • Australia / New Zealand
  • Canada
  • United Kingdom
  • United States (NS2)

 Please note that Sovereign Cloud is available on different infrastructures in those regions, e.g. hyperscalers like AWS or Azure.  

 Below please find an overview which CFIN relevant products are released in the Sovereign Cloud in selected regions:

Product

Status

SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Central Finance Foundation, Private Edition

Available

SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Central Finance Foundation, Private Edition, Tailored Option

On Request

SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

Available

The offering in Sovereign Cloud keeps growing:

We are continuously expanding our footprint into new countries and regions, enriching our solution portfolio, and enhancing our services. Expect regular updates, as there is an exciting roadmap ahead!

 

How could the Central Finance architecture look like in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2?

Every customer landscape is unique and that is also valid for the Central Finance architecture. There can be variances in each and every deployment, but there are roughly two deployment options to be considered, depending on the existing customer landscape:

 Option 1 (standard option)

 

Option 2*

*e.g. for customers who are already using a stand-alone SLT server

 

The offering in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2 continues to be extended ‚Äì so please stay tuned! üîä

entry.title: Extensibility in Supply Protection
entry.content:
Supply protection operates on some fundamental principles. A demand can match a time bucket, but it can't match different buckets within one protection group. Another core principle is that a matching demand only consumes the protection of the time bucket it matches. If there's no remaining protection for this bucket, the consumption is still recorded for this time bucket. In this case, the remaining protection is zero, not negative. 

Sometimes, customers prefer more flexibility. 

An alternative could be to shift consumption to a time bucket with remaining protection. If the protection of a time bucket is fully consumed, a matching demand should first consume protection of the previous or next time bucket instead of exceeding the protection of the current bucket. 

Another, more specific alternative could be a change for the privileged check quantity if supply protection is set to Restriction outside planned protection. With this setting, a demand has low restriction if protection is remaining for the matching time bucket. If there is no protection remaining, the restriction is quite high.  

Some customers like to be even more flexible. For example, they might want to use the quantity from the next time bucket, the aggregation of all time buckets in the group, or just a defined quantity as the privileged check quantity, instead of the quantity of a single time bucket.  

All these use cases are supported with the help of the available Business Add-Ins (BAdIs). 

  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Redistribution of Consumption (OP 2023 FPS0) 
    (ATP_SUP_REDISTRIBUTE_CNSMPN) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection ‚Äì Removal of Restriction Groups (OP2023 FPS0) 
    (ATP_SUP_REMOVAL_RSTRCN_GROUPS) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Remove Restriction Groups Inside Privileged Check Quantity (OP2023 FPS2) 
    (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_IN) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Remove Restriction Groups Outside Privileged Check Quantity (OP2023 FPS2) 
    (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_OUT) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Change of Remaining Protection of Matching Groups (OP2023 FPS2) 
    (ATP_SUP_CHANGE_GRPS_RMNG_PROT) 

Let‚Äôs take a look at the options the different BAdIs provide: 

Redistribution of Consumption (ATP_SUP_REDISTRIBUTE_CNSMPN) 

By default, the consumption of protection is assigned only to the matching time bucket and reduces the remaining protection. With the help of the BAdI to redistribute the consumption, it is also possible to write consumptions in other time buckets of the matching protection group. 

One use case is to only write consumptions in the matching time bucket if there is still a remaining protection. If all the protection is consumed, the next consumption should be assigned to another time bucket like the previous or the next time bucket. 


Illustration: Matching Sales Order


Illustration: Distribution of protection across different time buckets with BAdI ATP_SUP_REDISTRIBUTE_CNSMPN 

Removal of Restriction Groups (ATP_SUP_REMOVAL_RSTRCN_GROUPS) 

Higher or equally prioritized protection groups of the matching supply protection object are treated as restriction. Here, the BAdI ‚ÄúRemoval of Restriction Groups‚Äù can change the restrictions. It‚Äôs possible to ignore any other protection group of the matching supply protection object. With this a matching demand is less restricted and the likelihood of getting a confirmation for a request increases. 

For sure, the reliability of the protection in total is reduced if the restriction is not that strict. 

Illustration: Removal of Restrictions

Remove Restriction Groups Inside Privileged Check Quantity (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_IN) 

The restriction type ‚ÄúRestriction outside planned protection‚Äù is a bit more complex as there are potentially two different checks for the availability. If you are not familiar with the restriction type ‚ÄúRestriction outside planned protection‚Äù you should read the related community blog. 
One of the principles is as follows: If the requested quantity is below the remaining protection of the matching time bucket, the restriction is low. For requested quantities which exceed the remaining protection of the matching time bucket the restriction is high. 

Illustration: Removal of Restrictions ‚ÄùInside Privileged Check Quantity‚Äù

In the illustration, parallel restrictions with the same priority also exist. Equal and higher prioritized protections are considered as restrictions for the check ‚Äúinside the privileged check quantity‚Äù. With the BAdI ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_IN it is possible to remove these restrictions. 

Remove Restriction Groups Outside Privileged Check Quantity (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_OUT) 

For demands exceeding the remaining protection of the matching time bucket, the restriction might be high, as also lower prioritized protections are considered as restriction. This is a basic principle of the restriction type ‚ÄúRestriction outside planned protection‚Äù. However, for this kind of restrictions a BAdI exists to remove protection groups. If there are many vertical protection groups, it might be interesting to not be restricted by all the groups of lower priority, but just by the groups which are one or two levels below. 

Using the BAdIs to remove restrictions is something every customer should think about very carefully.
Although the following setting is possible, it might not always be reasonable. So, it would be wrong to have a demand facing a lower restriction if it is already outside of the own protection compared to the restrictions of the first check within the own protection. 


Illustration: Removal of Restrictions ‚ÄùOutside Privileged Check Quantity‚Äù 

Change of Remaining Protection of Matching Groups 
(ATP_SUP_CHANGE_GRPS_RMNG_PROT) 

With the BAdI ‚ÄúChange of Remaining Protection of Matching Groups‚Äù it is possible to change the quantity we also sometimes call the ‚ÄúInplan-Quantity‚Äù or the ‚Äúprivileged Quantity‚Äù. This is the quantity which is checked for the first check for the restriction type ‚ÄúRestriction outside planned Protection‚Äù. Sometime customers want to have more flexibility here as well. One simple use case is as follows ... 
If there are monthly time buckets the remaining protection might be quite low at the end of the month as the protection is already consumed. If the request matched the next time bucket, the confirmed quantities would be higher again. Therefore, some customers want to consider the protected quantities of the following or previous time bucket as an additional quantity for the first check. In this case they also want to redistribute the consumption afterwards again, so that consumptions exceeding the own planned protections are only stored at a time bucket, if the remaining protection of the surrounding time buckets is already expired.  


Illustration: With the BAdI ATP_SUP_CHANGE_GRPS_RMNG_PROT quantities of additional time buckets are considered as ‚ÄùPrivileged Check Quantity‚Äù

There are different options to change the logic of Supply Protection and customer can use the application more flexible. However, every change of the logic in standard has an impact, and the BAdIs should be used very carefully. 

Links 

SAP Help: App Extensibility: Manage Supply Protection (Key User)

entry.title: Unlock What‚Äôs New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series
entry.content:
Unlock What‚Äôs New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series

The 2025 release of SAP Cloud ERP Private brings powerful innovations across every line of business with an AI-First, Suite-First strategy by integrating applications, data, and AI ‚Äî from a strengthened core to embedded AI and intelligent agents that transform how work gets done.

You can join us December 8-11 in our exclusive deep-dive webinar series to discover how these new features provide tangible innovation impact across your key lines of business: 

  • Monday 8th Dec 4PM CET | 10AM EST- Overview of 2025 Cloud ERP Private Release Highlights, Procurement & Sales 
  • Tuesday 9th Dec 4PM CET | 10AM EST - Asset & Service Management
  • Wednesday 10th Dec 4PM CET | 10AM EST - Finance
  • Thursday 11th Dec 4PM CET | 10AM EST - Manufacturing, R&D and Supply Chain

This event is also open to partners.

 

 

Why should you attend?

In today‚Äôs fast-moving landscape, its important to stay up to date and adopt the innovations. In this series we will deep dive on the latest and greatest S/4HANA 2025 has to offer, so that you can plan your journey. We will cover:

Core Highlights:

  • Embedded AI: AI is integrated across key processes in your LoBs bringing precision and predictability to every decision.
  • Role-Aware Assistant: Joule is evolving into a role-aware assistant, tailoring insights and actions to each user‚Äôs responsibilities.
  • AI-Ready Data: Help businesses manage, analyze, and leverage their data with over 130 pre-delivered data products, accelerating decision-making.

LoB Highlights:

  • Finance: Achieve real-time profitability insight using universal parallel accounting and improve your cashflow with receivables and payables financing integrated with SAP Taulia. Improve liquidity with specialized agents like the Accounts Receivable Agent and shorten resolution cycle with the Dispute Management Agent.
  • Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Ensure faster, more reliable order fulfillment using the enhanced advanced available-to-promise (ATP) capability. Optimize warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning.
  • Asset and Service: Improve equipment reliability and reduce downtime. The Maintenance Planner Agent recommends maintenance events and coordinates schedules based on interconnected data.
  • Procurement: Use Joule to simplify the creation of self-service purchase requisition and benefit from migration reports to transition to Lean Services.
  • Sales: Streamlines sales operations with AI-assisted sales order fulfillment and solution quotation creation. Explore how enhanced sales order and returns order management increase efficiency.
 
Additional Resources
  1. Blog Post: Should you wait until FPS1 is available before implementing or upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025?
  2. SAP News Center Article: Detailed insights in 2025 release "From Innovation to Impact: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Release | SAP News Center‚Äù.
  3. SAP Community Posts: - List of publicly available content related to 2025 release 
  4. SAP.com Innovations Pages:
    • https://www.sap.com/products/erp/s4hana-private-edition.html#innovations 
    • https://www.sap.com/products/erp/s4hana-private-edition/innovations.html 

 

Register today to stay ahead with the latest innovations from SAP Cloud ERP Private.

For further information, please reach out to your SAP representative.

entry.title: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Foundational SAP Notes for SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
This blog post lists the main SAP Notes and software components for SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA 2025. 
This collection is provided as an aid to those customers installing or upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025 Cloud Private edition or SAP S/4HANA 2025 On-Premise.

Information is current for the initial shipment stack (ISS) of SAP S/4HANA 2025.

IMPORTANT: Many customers often ask whether they should wait for FPS1 before starting their SAP S/4HANA 2025 projects. To help clarify this, the SAP S/4HANA Regional Implementation Group (RIG) has published a dedicated blog:
Should you wait until FPS1 is available before implementing or upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025?

The blog explains that SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS00 is a mature and stable release, already shipping with the long-term maintenance version SAPUI5 1.136, so customers can confidently begin their implementations from day one without waiting for FPS1.

You can find additional information on the major changes for SAP Fiori in SAP S/4HANA 2025 in blog posts:

    • SAP User Experience Update: What‚Äôs New for SAP S/4HANA 2025 (Private Cloud and On-Premise)

You can find additional information on the major changes for SAP Fiori Frontend Server in blog post:

    • SAP Fiori deployment options and SAP Fiori front-end server strategy - UPDATE 2025

IMPORTANT: Especially please note the statements in the above blog post around Strategy and future direction for SAP Fiori front-end server. Especially:

SAP Fiori front-end server 2025 for SAP S/4HANA (SAP FES 2025) :

  • has the same deployment recommendations as the predecessor versions (embedded or standalone FES server for SAP S/4HANA systems, hub deployment for Business Suite).
  • The end of maintenance of SAP FES 2025 is aligned with the maintenance period of SAP S/4HANA 2025. See also SAP note 3574267 - SAP Fiori front-end server 2025 for SAP S/4HANA.

You can find additional information on the major changes for the ABAP Platform in blog post:

    • ABAP Platform - major changes - COMING SOON!

Upgrading from a lower release of SAP S/4HANA:

  • Make sure you are aware of the major shifts in SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA. Refer to: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Upgrade Faster ‚Äì Major shifts in SAP Fiori implementation

Planning to go Clean Core or use SAP Business AI with SAP S/4HANA 2025:

Refer to SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Minimum UX you need for SAP Business AI and Clean Core

New apps for SAP S/4HANA 2025:

The new apps are already available in the SAP Fiori apps reference library.

Particularly useful new apps are:

  • F8438 Manage News
  • F7763 Cost Centers Review Booklet

  • F7651 Manage Payment Orders

There are also significant improvements in extending apps with Adapt UI including:

  • What's New tour of Adapt UI 
  • New capabilities in changing table behaviors such as scrolling behaviour, text/id arrangements and many more. 

Hint: The library is regularly updated every couple of weeks with any changes.

SAP Help Documentation guides for SAP Fiori on SAP S/4HANA

SAP Fiori launchpad for SAP S/4HANA 2025

When using the What's New Viewer - SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition  filter on solution area ABAP Platform, valid as of release 2025, and look for solution capability SAP Fiori launchpad

Particularly useful new tools are:

  • Launchpad Content Aggregator for Roles now includes both content and layouts - refer to transaction /UI2/FLPCA
  • Launchpad Content Aggregator for User - refer to transaction /UI2/FLPCA_USER
  • You can set launchpad configuration parameters (client settings) for roles - refer to transaction /UI2/FLP_PROF_CONF
  • You can access an Administrator view of App Support, called the App Inspector.

3516556 - SAP_UI 8.16 minimal installation requirements

3516611 - UI Version for SAP ABAP Platform: Mapping support package stack SAP_UI 8.16 to UI5 versions

IMPORTANT: Once you have installed or upgraded to SAP S/4HANA 2025, you should immediately check and patch up your minor versions for all UI technologies. That is you should patch up your minor versions for:

    • SAPUI5 version ‚Äì for Fiori launchpad and SAP Fiori apps
    • Kernel version ‚Äì for SAP GUI for HTML and SAP GUI for Windows
    • Unified Rendering version ‚Äì for SAP GUI for HTML and ABAP Web Dynpro applications

Patching for SAP Fiori ( SAPUI5 )

Find the current minor patch levels at SAPUI5 Versions Maintenance Overview

You can find a short FAQ list on the patching process in SAP Note 2346367 ‚Äì How to upgrade the SAPUI5 library in ABAP

The changes implemented by the patch are described in the UI5 Change Log ‚Äì go to https://ui5.sap.com/#/releasenotes.html  and select release 1.136

Patching for Kernel

Find the current minor patch levels by checking the SAP Note 2083594 ‚Äì SAP Kernel Versions and SAP Kernel Patch Levels . This includes the link to the latest patch note in the format: SAP Kernel <major version> Patch Level <patch level number>

For example:
3633957 - SAP Support Package Stack Kernel 9.16 PL 50 (RTC)

Patching for Unified Rendering

Find the current minor patch levels by checking the SAP Notes:

For Web Dynpro for ABAP ‚Äì  SAP Note 2090746 - WD ABAP: Unified Rendering Update with TCI - Instructions and Related SAP Notes

Check the Solution section for your SAP_UI component version and the associate UR version and its SAP Note.

For SAP GUI for HTML ‚Äì SAP Note 2504011 ‚Äì SAP GUI for HTML: Unified Rendering Update ‚Äì Instructions and Forecasts

You can find more information in SAP Note 2500800 ‚Äì Cumulative patches for Unified Rendering

Add-ons and software components with SAP Fiori apps or features

3624380 - Release of Fiori Product Versions for SAP Fiori front-end server 2025 for SAP S/4HANA

3643145 ‚Äì Release strategy and Maintenance Information for the ABAP add-on UIGRCGTS 300

2013453 ‚Äì Release strategy for ABAP add-on PERSONAS

Notable changes in Catalogs, Groups, and Spaces

3676618 - Release Information: Changes in SAP Fiori Content for International Trade Management in SAP S/4HANA 2025

Notable restrictions in Apps and UIs

IMPORTANT: To find out the obsolete, deprecated, and superseded SAP Fiori apps, GUI transactions, Web Dynpro apps, and Web Client UIs, please use the SAP Fiori Upgrade Impact Analysis on the SAP Fiori apps reference library

3632817 - Restrictions of Advanced Scheduling Board Fiori Application in On-Premise 2025 release

Additional Notes for Upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025

33634200 - SAP S/4HANA 2025 - application specific notes in system conversion / release upgrade preparation phase

3634222 - SAP S/4HANA 2025 - application specific notes in system conversion / release upgrade follow-on phase

3646962 - MDG-BP/C/S: Upgrade and Conversion to SAP S/4HANA 2025

For other user experience changes refer to:

  • What‚Äôs new viewer for ABAP Platform

IMPORTANT:  You can also use the Upgrade Impact Analysis in the SAP Fiori apps reference library to plan for changes in apps and UIs. Find out how in Running an App Upgrade Impact Analysis.

Updating Rapid Activation and other tools

For Rapid Content Activation:

SAP Note 3608355 - Composite SAP note: Rapid Activation for SAP Fiori in SAP S/4HANA 2025

For SAP GUI for HTML (WebGUI):

Run transaction SITSPMON  and navigate to tab WebGUI Health Check

For SAP Screen Personas:

SAP Note 3525171 - SAP Screen Personas 3.0 SP19: Released Notes Information

 

Becoming a SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA guru

You‚Äôll find much more on our  SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA topic page

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA RIG and Customer Care team

entry.title: Streamline Your SAP Cloud ERP Private Upgrades with the New Release Upgrade Management Application
entry.content:
Upgrades are a critical part of keeping your SAP Cloud ERP Private environment secure, compliant, and ready for innovation. But coordinating them across complex system landscapes has traditionally required multiple tools, spreadsheets, and manual steps.

With SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition, SAP handles the technical side of your upgrades, applying standardized and proven methods for consistency and reliability.
Meanwhile, you and your implementation partner lead the planning and post-upgrade activities, ensuring everything runs seamlessly from preparation to go-live.

To make this process even easier, SAP now provides the Release Upgrade Management app ‚Äî a centralized tool in SAP for Me that helps you plan, coordinate, and monitor your upgrade projects end-to-end.

 

Watch the Overview Video

Here‚Äôs a brief overview of how the Release Upgrade Management app helps you organize and manage your SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition upgrades. Watch the video. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What Led Us to Create the Release Upgrade Management Application

Planning and executing an upgrade project require close coordination across your entire system landscape.

Historically, much of this coordination happened through spreadsheets, emails, or manual processes. The Release Upgrade Management Application changes that.

The tool was developed by SAP Enterprise Cloud Services (ECS) to make upgrade planning transparent, structured, and collaborative ‚Äî allowing customers, partners, and SAP teams to work together in one place. With it, you can map out your upgrade across your entire landscape, see how everything is connected, and prepare the work without running into unexpected issues. It also helps you estimate the time and resources to keep your productive environment stable until the scheduled downtime.

The goal is to make upgrades more predictable, less stressful and easier to manage. 

 

How Release Upgrade Management Helps You

After logging in via SAP for Me > Services & Support > Private Cloud Workspace > Release Upgrade Management, you can:

  • Set up an upgrade project , define the scope and target release, connected agents, and system landscape
  • Identify the optimal upgrade path using built-in best practices and dependency analysis for OS, DB, and application versions
  • Generate an upgrade timeline automatically that you can adapt to match your internal planning cycle. 
  • Track and manage tasks across all phases ‚Äî discovery, planning, preparation, execution, and review ‚Äî with clear responsibilities for SAP and customer teams
  • Collaborate in one shared workspace for customers, partners and SAP using notes, attachments, and comments to stay aligned at every stage.
  • Leverage insights from past projects to reuse templates and and make future upgrades easier to plan.

 

Explore the Guided Demo

See a walkthrough of how to set up, plan, and track an upgrade project in SAP for Me. Watch the demo video. 

 



 

 

Two Versions, Depending on Your Needs

Release Upgrade Management is available in two editions:

  • Basic Version: Included for all SAP Enterprise Cloud Services customers, covering the essential planning and monitoring features.
  • Enhanced Operations Version: Available for customers with the enhanced operations service for managed upgrades and updates package, which includes dedicated SAP project management and Basis consulting support.

Both versions provide the same intuitive, self-service access ‚Äî the difference lies in how SAP supports the execution. Learn more here.

 

Get Started

You can access the Release Upgrade Management application via SAP for Me ‚Üí Service & Support ‚Üí Private Cloud Workspace ‚Üí Release Upgrade Management.

Resources and Support:

  • Read SAP Note 3372118 for the latest information and user guide
  • For questions and feedback contact the Release Upgrade Management product team at SAP_ECS_RUM_tool@sap.com
  • Report issues via this technical support component in SAP For Me: XX-SER-FORME-ECS-RUM

If you're working through upcoming upgrades, the Release Upgrade Management application may help you organize the tasks and see the overall plan more clearly. Feedback from the community will continue to shape how the tool evolves.
